titleStmt.title: The testament of William Bel. Gentleman Left written in his owne hand. Sett out above 33. yeares after his death. With annotations at the end, and sentences, out of the H. Scripture, fathers, &c. By his sonne Francis Bel, of the Order of Freers Minors, definitor of the province of England: guardian of S. Bonaventures colledge in Dovvay: and professor of the sacred Hebrevv tongue, in the same. Electo meo fœdus excidi
titleStmt.author: Bell, William, d. 1598.

notesStmt.note: Printer and date of publication from STC.
At foot of title: Permissu superiorum.
Imperfect; cropped, affecting imprint and text; tightly bound.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
